turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Smoking ban.
turn.1: When did the no smoking in indoor places come into effect?
turn.2: A strict law aimed to protect people’s health from tobacco smoke and the consequences of smoking that introduced a ban on smoking in all closed public areas in compliance with the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control took effect on 1 June 2013.
turn.3: What happened if someone disobeys the law?
turn.4: At first smoking ban abusers were not fined - the mechanism was still under consideration.
turn.5: What are some places that are included in the no smoking law?
turn.6: The law prohibits smoking at schools and universities, cultural and sporting organizations, beaches, stadiums, on playgrounds and in hospitals, in sanatoriums and at health resorts, inside the offices of public organizations and at filling stations.
turn.8: Smoking is banned aboard aircraft, on the subway and all kinds of public transport.
turn.9: Are there any other consequences for disobeying the law?
turn.10: From 15 November 2013 on, smoking at working places, near and within the educational, cultural, sporting and healthcare organizations, in houses’ hallways, at railway stations and airports is to be punished with a fine from 500 to 1,500 roubles ($15 – 45.5).
turn.11: Who is the law made for?
turn.12: The management of organizations where the ban is violated will face tougher fines.
